meanings.definition: Face up to and deal with (a problem or difficult situation)
meanings.sent1: She had to confront her fear of heights to climb the ladder.
meanings.sent2: He decided to confront the issue head-on and find a solution.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to confront the challenge of catching the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: The student had to confront the mountain of homework waiting for him.
meanings.sent5: Confronting the dragon, the knight felt a surge of bravery within him.

meanings.definition: Meet (someone) face to face with hostile or argumentative intent
meanings.sent1: The detective had to confront the suspect in the interrogation room.
meanings.sent2: The rival gang members decided to confront each other in the alley.
meanings.sent3: The two cats decided to confront each other over the last piece of fish.
meanings.sent4: The hero had to confront the villain in a final showdown.
meanings.sent5: Confronting the bully, the boy stood his ground and defended his friend.

meanings.sent1: The new evidence will confront the old theory and require a reevaluation.
meanings.sent2: The team will confront the reigning champions in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle will confront your problem-solving skills and keep you engaged.
meanings.sent4: The storm will confront the strength of the old tree standing in its path.
meanings.sent5: Confronting the status quo, the activist demanded change for a better future.
